p: The enhanced expression of the GA 3-regulated 1,3-Î²-glucanases during pre-dormancy chilling is congruent with the simultaneous upregulation of the GA-biosynthesis and signalling genes (Fig. 6a). That GA-catabolism was also enhanced (Fig. 6a), like in dormancy release [ 40], could indicate that GA2ox1 functions to deactivate growth-related GA 4. The present findings suggest the possibility that pre-dormancy chilling triggers the premature involvement of the 13-hydroxylation pathway of GA biosynthesis, increasing the level of GA 3.
